page.title: 04Services to Yelden
page.content: The Dustcart collects household rubbish once a week and leaves 2 large plastic sacks per house. Periodically a large skip is placed in the village for the disposal of large unwanted things. (most of the things that are thrown away by one person are hurriedly retrieved by somebody else!) The Mobile Library from Kempston calls once every 2 weeks with a selection of books which may be borrowed free of charge. Specific books if not available may be ordered for a charge of 13p each. The van also displays information on places of interest, education, evening classes and entertainment in the area. Medical attention can be sought from Sharnbrook or Rushden. Sharnbrook patients are referred to Bedford or Huntingdon Hospitals and Rushden, Kettering,northampton, Wellingborough.
